findings.title: Contract owner has no other controls except creating mixers
findings.description: The contract owner lacks fine-grained permissions and only has control over creating mixers.

findings.title: No Function to Remove or Edit a Mixer
findings.description: There is no function to remove or edit a mixer. Necessity of updates on existing mixers have to be carefully reviewed considering this issue.

findings.title: Solidity Compiler Version should be locked
findings.description: Pragma should be simplified and the version should be locked for published contracts, ideally using the most recent Solidity compiler version supported by the build framework.

findings.title: Multiple hardcoded keys on _verifyingKey and verify_ functions
findings.description: Hardcoded values can lead to vulnerabilities. Create functions to update these values or make sure you are using them right.

findings.title: Hardcoded address on _withdraw_ function
findings.description: Hardcoded addresses can lead to vulnerabilities since smart contracts cannot be modified after deployment.

findings.title: No mechanism for handling addresses that reject cryptocurrency transfer
findings.description: The relayer does not have a mechanism to handle transactions sent to addresses that reject cryptocurrency transfers, which can result in key usage without transaction rollback.

findings.title: Insecure approve() Implementation
findings.description: The ERC-20(BEP-20) standard has a security vulnerability related to the approve() method being vulnerable to race-condition.
